page.title: 08BUILDINGS IN CROSS & BURNESS
page.content: There are{3 main types}of buildings in the parish of Cross & Burness: {(1)OLD STONE-BUILT "MANSIONS"}- Eg. Marygarth, which is a{large two-storey {T-shaped}house with{12 rooms.}The back wing was built in 1866 & the front added in 1880. The{rooms}are{large}& {square}with{high ceilings.}There are 6 {Victorian fireplaces}still in use, 3 have been blocked up. There was a vast open range in the kitchen, but now there is an{oil_fired Rayburn cooker. {(2)MODERN TIMBER-FRAMED BUNGALOWS}- Eg Smith's Cott, which has{double_glazing on all the windows. It is{centrally {heated}from an{oil_fired boiler}with {radiators}in every room. {(3)CONVERTED BUILDINGS}- Eg. Alma Cottage, which used to be a {blacksmith's forge;}Thorwald Garage, which was a{bakehouse;}& Parlgo, which was a{shop.
